Yingwen Huang, under the supervision of John Zarrillo
Edward and Charlotte Artus family photographs
Edward and Charlotte Artus family photographs

The Edward and Charlotte Artus family photographs span from 1920 to 1940 depict the Artus family's connection to their friends and relatives, as well as their summer retreats and outdoor recreation at various parks and beaches in Long Island and New Jersey. Edward A. Artus (1896-1973) was a machinist born and raised in Brooklyn. He met Charlotte at the National Biscuit Company and the couple married in 1921. The family later moved to New Jersey in the 1930s with their daughter Mildred.

The Edward and Charlotte Artus family photographs span from 1920 to 1940 depict the Artus family's connection to their friends and relatives, as well as their summer retreats and outdoor recreation at various parks and beaches in Long Island and New Jersey. Edward A. Artus (1896-1973) was a machinist born and raised in Brooklyn. He met Charlotte at the National Biscuit Company and the couple married in 1921. The family later moved to New Jersey in the 1930s with their daughter Mildred.

The Edward and Charlotte Artus family photographs consist of 57 black-and-white photographs of a family who resided in Brooklyn, New York and New Jersey, dating from 1920 to 1940. The photographs depict the family home in Woodhaven (Queens), family retreats, and outdoor recreation activities at Jones Beach, Heckscher State Park, and Edgewater Camp.

Edward A. Artus (1896-1973) was a machinist born and raised in Brooklyn. Edward met Charlotte Marie (Kirschenheiter) Artus (1892-1971) at the National Biscuit Company, whom he later married in 1921. After their marriage, Charlotte became a housewife and began taking care of their daughter, Mildred L. Artus (1922-1975). The family moved to New Jersey in the 1930s. The family often spend their summer at camps and beaches with their relatives and friends on Long Island and New Jersey.
Source: New York Family Group Sheet for the Edward August Artus Family. http://www.fgs-project.com/newyork/groups/a/artus-edward-august.html
